description: An ancient river of Asia Minor that scholars identify with the modern Acı Çay upriver from its confluence with the Tatlı Çay south of Çankırı (ancient Gangra).

history.comment: summary; added OSM locations based on ways for the portion of the Acı çay labeled as "Halmyros" in the Barrington Atlas (the so-named modern river extends much southward of that point, but is labeled "Xanthos" in BAtlas. Added modern name after BAtlDir.
replacing the abbreviation fl. with (river) to bring titles into conformance with Editorial Guidelines
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012
Finding rivers by their titles and setting feature types
Detail text updated from former modernLocation. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceDetailsUpgrade
